name: bluster
content:
bluster verb [I]
(PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to speak in a loud, angry, or offended way, usually with little effect: [ + speech ] "You had no right to do it, no right at all," he blustered.

bluster verb [I]
(WIND)
If the wind blusters, it blows strongly: A gale was blustering around the house.

loud, angry, or offended talk, usually with little effect: I knew that it was all bluster and he wasn't really angry with me. His tough talk amounts to no more than macho bluster.
